subject.normal: Serverside Geocoding on Google App Engine = 620?

headers.subject: Serverside Geocoding on Google App Engine = 620?
headers.received: by yw-out-2122.google.com with SMTP id 1so1333195ywp.75 for <denise.farmer.rivas@a.markmail.org>; Mon, 22 Jun 2009 06:03:32 -0700 (PDT)
headers.x-http-useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10_5_7; de-de) AppleWebKit/530.17 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Safari/530.17,gzip(gfe),gzip(gfe)

body.para: I'm using Google Maps in a Mashup on Google App Engine. What I do is getting user-entered City and Country on a cron basis from another Web 2.0 platform, geocode them, save to cache and use Google Maps to display the cached User on a world map.
Now I'm getting 620 Errors fairly regular. About 70 % of my requests get rejected with 620 error code but the other 30 % work fine.

I have about 1000 geocode requests a day. It's something like 2 requests every 3 minutes (with 5 second between the actual requests within one cronjob). So I think I'm not hitting quota limits at all. I also don't think that this legally contradicts with any TOS, since I'm only doing the caching to good use with Google Maps.
I also paused the cronjob for two days, to see if it might be a quota based on day, but the 620 behaviour remained.

As mentioned I'm using Google App Engine. My suggestion is, that there is more people on Appengine querying the geocode api and we may share the same quota, even though we don't know about each other.
So is anyonw having an idea? Or whats the best way to contact the Maps or Appengine team about this issue other than the mailing lists?
The mashup can be found here: http://tinyurl.com/lhr4sp
body.footer:
